title: STEM Education Program for Improving Engineering Awareness Among Pre-Service Science Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Science Knowledge and General Understanding of Mathematics and STEM Education
context.additional_context: Math-based STEM education for general citizens, aiming to improve preservice science teachers’ stereotypes about engineering and engineers.

learning_goals: Learners can describe and apply the five stages of the Engineering Design Process (EDP)—problem definition, research, solution development, design optimization, and communication—to real-world cases.
Learners can recognize stereotypes about "engineers" (e.g., male-dominated, individual work, manual labor) and propose alternative perspectives.
Learners can collaboratively design engineering solutions to everyday problems using a STEM-integrated approach.

resources: Low-Cost Teaching Materials (LEGO, Paper Models, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
